results.title: Breaking the waves
results.creator_credit: Zentropa Entertainments, La Sept Cinema, Vibeke Windelov, Peter Aalbaek Jensen and Lars Von Trier
results.brief_description: A moving portrayal of Bess, a devout, innocent woman who lives in an isolated Scottish fishing village. The warmth and love she has found in her marriage to oil-rig worker Jan is shattered by an accident that leaves him paralysed from the neck down. When he encourages Bess to have sex with other men, she is propelled into a personal and religious crisis that the claustrophobic and repressive community of the village only makes worse. The visual style of the film evokes a fly-on-the-wall, documentary feel achieved by Muellers hand-held camerawork. Beyond this filming technique, the wide-screen stock was put through a film-video-film transfer process, muting the colour and producing noticeable grain. Emily Watson won Berlin Film Festival and New York Critics Circle Best Actress awards, and was nominated for an oscar for her finely articulated performance of a woman made victim to the desires and dictates of the men around her. The film won the Grand Jury Prize at Cannes in 1996. Cast includes Emily Watson, Stellan Skarsgard, Katrin Cartlidge, Jean-Marc Barr, Adrian Rawlins and Sandra Voe.

results.title: Breaking the ice
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and Ian Cuming
results.brief_description: Tim Bowden takes us on one of the last greatest adventures - a voyage to the Australian Antarctic Territory in this spectacular 6 part travel series. Over a period of 2 months Tim visited all 4 of Australia’s Antarctic stations at Macquarie Island Casey, Davis and Mawson. The result is a fascinating ‘behind the scenes’ look at what Australians are doing in Antarctica - a wild and beautiful icy wilderness that has attracted adventurers and scientists since the days of Scott, Shackleton and Mawson. Highlight include spectacular views of Australia’s only ice-breaking ship “Aurora Australis” charging through the pack ice, a visit to a new Emperor Penguin colony the day after it was discovered and superb footage of penguins, elephant seals and albatrosses on sub-Antarctic Macquarie Island.

results.title: Breaking the habit
results.creator_credit: Korty Films, American Cancer Society, Henry Jacobs and John Korty
results.brief_description: With the theme: “the self-delusion of the cigarette smoker”, records a conversation between two cartoon characters, George, the “quitting” smoker, and his friend. Concludes on a serious but hopeful note, pointing out that the chances of developing serious diseases decrease the moment you stop smoking.

results.title: Breaking the delegation barrier
results.creator_credit: Roundtable Films and Leon S. Gold
results.brief_description: How successful delegation sets free the energy and talents which are the real strength of any undertaking and the importance of overcoming the basic psychological obstacle: fear. At an organisational conference, three men competent and experienced in their own fields, but new to the responsibilities of supervision, are put in charge of newly expanded departments and are faced with a deadline resulting from a rush contract. As the months pass, each experiences and overcomes three of the most prevalent fears of delegation; fear of loss of job satisfaction, of mistakes and their repercussions and fear of loss of authority and prestige.

results.title: Breaking silence
results.brief_description: An epidemic number of children endure their early years in confusion and shame as victims of incest and other forms of sexual exploitation. This documentary goes behind the veneer of domestic bliss to study the incidence and effect of incest on families.

results.title: Breaking point
results.creator_credit: Granada Television International and Jack Smith
results.brief_description: This film on safety shows how spinal injuries may be caused by incorrect posture during the lifting or pushing of heavy objects. Injuries due to car accidents are discussed and the use of seatbelts ito minimise accidents is demonstrated.

results.title: Breaking out of The Doll's House
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America and Joseph Losey
results.brief_description: This film is edited from the feature film “The Doll’s House” which is an adaptation of the play by Ibsen, written in 1879. Jane Fonda plays the role of the main character Nora. A series of events in Nora’s married life forces her to turn back on her family and search for her own identity. This film raises discussion on the issues of feminine identity and is recommended for Years 11-12.

results.title: Breaking in children (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
Behaviour therapy although popular in the US as a method of treating difficult children is usually regarded by British authorities as fit only for animal training. This program looks at a therapist in Belfast working with two uncontrollable children and their mothers in an obey-reward, non compliance-punishment regime.

results.title: Breaking bows & arrows = Breaking bows and arrows
results.creator_credit: Tiger Eye, Firelight Film, Ellenor Cox and Liz Thompson
results.brief_description: On the island of Bougainville in Papua New Guinea, thousands of people were killed in a war of secession that grew from a local uprising against the Australian copper company CRA. The Bougainville Revolutionary Army was pitted against Papua New Guinean military forces, funded and trained by the Australian government. When the ten-year-old civil war ended in 1998, the islanders had to deal with the legacy of conflict between neighbours and begin to confront the challenging emotional terrain of personal reconciliation. “Breaking bows and arrows” documents the islanders’ road to forgiveness and healing, a process governed by their own cultural tradition. Traditional ceremonies and rituals played a powerful role in the reconciliation process, bringing together both victims and perpetrators in an attempt to heal the deep emotional wounds and reverse the legacy of anger, pain, and revenge. A powerful documentary that demonstrates that the path to true reconciliation begins with forgiveness. Teachers notes are available at http://www.filmaust.com.au/programs.
results.title_for_label: Breaking bows & arrows = Breaking bows and arrows
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tiger Eye, Firelight Film, Ellenor Cox and Liz Thompson
results.description: On the island of Bougainville in Papua New Guinea, thousands of people were killed in a war of secession that grew from a local uprising against the Australian copper company CRA. The Bougainville Revolutionary Army was pitted against Papua New Guinean military forces, funded and trained by the Australian government. When the ten-year-old civil war ended in 1998, the islanders had to deal with the legacy of conflict between neighbours and begin to confront the challenging emotional terrain of personal reconciliation. “Breaking bows and arrows” documents the islanders’ road to forgiveness and healing, a process governed by their own cultural tradition. Traditional ceremonies and rituals played a powerful role in the reconciliation process, bringing together both victims and perpetrators in an attempt to heal the deep emotional wounds and reverse the legacy of anger, pain, and revenge. A powerful documentary that demonstrates that the path to true reconciliation begins with forgiveness. Teachers notes are available at http://www.filmaust.com.au/programs.
